snippet: The controversy over the state’s next chief justice shows why it’s still necessary to enforce voting-rights laws.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Louisiana Gov Bobby Jindal and state's six white Supreme Court justices for attempting to prevent Justice Bernette J Johnson, second African-American to ever serve on the court, from becoming chief justice; argues attitudes of Jindal and the other justices show why voting-rights enforcement remains necessary in Louisiana.
lead_paragraph: The controversy over the state’s next chief justice shows why it’s still necessary to enforce voting-rights laws.
